thread.title: Amazon gets its most bullish Wall Street call yet: $1,800 price forecast

title: Amazon gets its most bullish Wall Street call yet: $1,800 price forecast
text:
Amazon gets its most bullish Wall Street call yet: $1,800 price forecast D.A. Davidson raises its 12-month price target to $1,800 from $1,500, citing optimism over Amazon's cloud business. The firm's forecast is the highest target out of the 42 analysts who cover Amazon, according to FactSet. 13 Mins Ago | 00:43 
Amazon's cloud business is just getting started, according to one Wall Street firm. 
D.A. Davidson increased its price target for Amazon shares to $1,800 from $1,500, representing 33 percent upside to Wednesday's close. It's the highest target out of the 42 analysts who cover Amazon, according to FactSet. 
"We see two potential catalysts for shares over the next 12-month period: stronger-than-expected operating results from the company's cloud computing efforts, which we believe remains the primary driver of its share price and 2) due to its increasing mix of highly-profitable third-party sales (which surpassed 50% for the first time in 2Q17)," analyst Tom Forte wrote in a note to clients Thursday. 
The firm also reiterated its buy rating. If Amazon's stock reaches Forte's $1,800 forecast, the company's market value would be nearly $870 billion. 
Amazon's shares were up slightly Thursday. The company reports fourth-quarter earnings next Thursday. 
â€” CNBC's Michael Bloom contributed to this story. WATCH: How Amazon has changed the Seattle skyline in the last 3 years show chapters
